nodes.bodyText: is this going to affect any customers who might be setting this property? Or do we not expose this property and we're fine to just use CXF's property?

is this going to affect any customers who might be setting this property? Or do we not expose this property and we're fine to just use CXF's property?

The latter.  We don't expose this property - it is only used internally for cases where the user has invoked an SSL-related API in either the JAX-RS Client or MP Rest Client - then we set that property so that we override the normal SSL config process with the setting specified by the user.

we should always specify EXACT on the versions to avoid potential "soft matching" artifacts in Artifactory. I've had to sort out those issues before where a new artifact gets uploaded and for some reason it starts matching to the wrong version.

nodes.bodyText: leads me to believe we don't need EXACT on the others for now? not sure. Enjoy the spam.

+	*
+
+Include-Resource: \
+  @${repo;org.eclipse.microprofile.rest.client:microprofile-rest-client-api;2.0}
+# TODO: when replacing 2.0-RC2 with 2.0, make sure to add EXACT:

nodes.bodyText: I would recommend including "ibm" or similar in the snapshot version to make it clear we built it e.g. org.apache.cxf:cxf-rt-transports-http:3.4.1-ibm20201002. The wiki for this goes a step further and suggests changing the group id to com.ibm.ws.org.apache.cxf ... I think that is overkill.

nodes.bodyText:
All of these binaries are actual CXF snapshots available (for a limited time) at:
https://repository.apache.org/content/groups/snapshots/org/apache/cxf/
We're still using the overlay approach (for now) so all IBM changes are part of the Open Liberty repo.  But this PR ends up removing ~30 overlayed files which should make it easier to move off of that approach.
